results.title: Planning your career (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
In many organisations, preparation for people to assume management positions is often poor and unstructured. While people should undertake career planning, organisations should also encourage career development skills. This episode focuses on two case studies of cadet mangement programs operating at the ANZ Bank and Coles Myer.

results.title: Planning for personal and professional growth
results.creator_credit: George L. George, McGraw-Hill Films and Sturgis-Grant Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Planning for Teaching”.
Shows how teachers need to maintain their own mental growth and resilience to make the most of teaching. Dramatises cases of four typical teachers to explain how a teacher can avoid failure and frustration, and give inspiration instead of boredom to their charges. Stresses that teachers need to make conscious effort to deepen their understanding.

results.creator_credit: Biographic Films and Central Office of Information

results.title: Planning and laying out work
results.creator_credit: J Studebaker, Mode-Art Pictures and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: A number of dramatised incidents emphasise the importance of careful planning before starting a job; the serious results of poor planning, or no planning at all, are demonstrated.

results.title: Planning a water harvesting project
results.brief_description: Certain aspects of the water harvesting project developed at the Sydney University Farm, Badgery’s Creek. Describes the essential needs on an average farm and shows the construction of storage dams, various irrigation systems available, and the correct application of irrigation to pastures.

results.title: Planned town
results.brief_description: Explains the planning of Welwyn Garden City, Herts., established in 1920 as a comprehensive project providing for varied residential areas with associated industries, shopping and other community needs grouped according to a consistent scheme.

results.title: Planned for the purpose
results.creator_credit: Peter M Plaskitt, Humphrey Swingler, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: This film aims at persuading managements to replan their factories and introduce work-flow, modern lighting and other developments. Points out that rises in productivity in steel-making, printing and laundering firms resulted from improved plant layout. Stresses the importance of co-operation between management and their commercial and technical staffs, and also that redundancy is not necessarily the consequence of rising output.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter M Plaskitt, Humphrey Swingler, Film Producers Guild and Greenpark Productions

results.title: Plankton to fish: a food cycle
results.brief_description: A sequence of three major links - plankton, water fleas and fish - is selected to demonstrate the food chain as a continuous cycle in different aquariums. We observe the effects of varying the fish population and what happens when the balance is upset. Viewers are led to collect and compare visual evidence and evaluate the factors that contribute to the satisfactory function of the chain.

results.title: Planing machines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Woodworking machinery series”.
A surface planing machine is shown in use. Its principle is explained by animated diagrams. The method of sharpening cutters by machine is demonstrated.
